revised_title: Isolation and Growth of the Lepra Bacillus
tldr: The authors successfully isolated and grew the lepra bacillus, a bacterium responsible for leprosy, using a special medium containing extracts of tubercle bacilli. This breakthrough could potentially lead to the development of a vaccine for treating leprosy. The researchers also isolated and grew the acid-fast bacillus found in cows with Johne's disease, with plans to develop a diagnostic vaccine in the future.
